Quadratic sieve:
	http://www.cs.virginia.edu/crab/QFS_Simple.pdf
	http://websites.math.leidenuniv.nl/algebra/sieving.pdf
Gaussian elimination in GF(2)
	https://www.cs.umd.edu/~gasarch/TOPICS/factoring/fastgauss.pdf

Got mipr from https://github.com/Legrandin/mpir-windows-builds

Build command: something like
cmake .. -DBOOST_ROOT=/c/Users/marco.oman/Documents/boost_1_70_0/ \
         -DGMP_ROOT=/C/Users/marco.oman/Documents/git/mpir/lib/Win32/Release

Some tests:
time ./main --n=13090163955597839265304386635828428567856324123 --base-size=3200 --qsc
107355708017137734566479 * 121932631225422966763637 = 13090163955597839265304386635828428567856324123

user    0m0.000s
sys     0m0.047s

This is the result after a few optimization attempts
time ./main.exe --n=43169554144061480807721762059907068496313438381696909238551841 --base-size=3900 --m=160000 --mpqs
Factorization of 43169554144061480807721762059907068496313438381696909238551841
Actual base size: 4294, largest = 88873
16678. Sieving.. 4300, candidates 131990, base = 4253

4359007920413667370172316923219 * 9903527346645590562451939047739 = 43169554144061480807721762059907068496313438381696909238551841

real    0m55.637s
user    0m0.000s
sys     0m0.000s

(61.6 dgt)

This is fast
 --n=1204048731521109002548486995507186577156370524236794079157628148119  --base-size=6000 --m=250000 --mpqs
 while this is slow
 --n=15375731966173843015824519811474362830016562876511945643265979445013  --base-size=6000 --m=250000 --mpqs

 There is a strange performance drop. To be inv1estigated...
